alert.note: Alert for Southeast Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued January 10 at 7:12PM EST until January 10 at 11:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Watch, potential for 2 to locally 3 ft of inundation above ground level in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southwest Suffolk, Southeast Suffolk and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Statement, until 11 PM EST this evening. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Potential for widespread moderate to locally major flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline Saturday morning. Potential for 2 to locally 3 ft of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This would result in numerous road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront would likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...For this evening, breaking waves of 10 to 15 ft along the oceanfront will result in beach flooding and scattered dune erosion with this evening high tide. Overwashes are not expected this evening. For Friday Night into Saturday, large breaking waves of 12 to 16 ft along the oceanfront will likely result in widespread dune erosion and damage to dune structures. Scattered overwashes are likely, resulting in some flooding of roadways and vulnerable structures behind protective dunes. Isolated breaches or inundation of the barrier island is possible where dune structures have been severely compromised by previous storms. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Timing of windshift of southeasterly gales to southwesterly gales in relation to the time of high tide Saturday morning will be key to water level forecast. This will be refined over the next 48 hours. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. GREAT SOUTH BAY AT LINDENHURST NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 3.1 FT, MODERATE 3.6 FT, MAJOR 4.1 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.0 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 11/10 AM 1.9/ 2.3 0.2/ 0.8 0.4/ 0.9 0-1 NONE 11/10 PM 1.2/ 1.7 -0.5/ 0.0 0.0/ 0.5 0-1 NONE 12/11 AM 1.8/ 2.2 0.2/ 0.7 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE 13/12 AM 3.0/ 3.5 1.4/ 1.9 1.9/ 2.3 2-3 MINOR 13/11 AM 3.7/ 4.2 2.2/ 2.7 2.2/ 2.7 2 MOD-MAJ GREAT SOUTH BAY AT WEST SAYVILLE NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk
